briefdescription.para: Checks if the GPU scaling is enabled on a display.

detaileddescription.para: Checks if the GPU scaling is enabled on a display.

entry.para: The pointer to a variable where the state of GPU scaling is returned. The variable is true if GPU scaling is enabled. The variable is false if GPU scaling is not enabled.

detaileddescription.para: If the state of GPU scaling is successfully returned, ADLX_OK is returned. If the state of GPU scaling is not successfully returned, an error code is returned. Refer to ADLX_RESULT for success codes and error codes.

GPU scaling uses the GPU to scale up lower resolutions to fit the display. GPU scaling requires a digital connection (DVI, HDMI or DisplayPort™) from the display to the GPU. Note: Integer Display Scaling is not supported when GPU scaling is disabled. GPU scaling is required for Radeon™ Super Resolution. GPU scaling is automatically enabled when Radeon Super Resolution is enabled.
